District 99’s two high schools are in the top 15% of Illinois schools in U.S. News & World Report’s 2020 listing of America’s Best High Schools. Among 665 Illinois high schools, North High was ranked 45th and South High was ranked 98th.

“We are proud of the fact that both of our schools are among the best in the state and in the nation,” says Dr. Hank Thiele, superintendent. “The success of our students reflects the efforts of the teachers, staff, parents, caregivers and volunteers who make our schools outstanding places for students to learn, grow and prepare for the future.”

Read more from U.S. News and World Report about each school's ranking, and ranking methodology, here: https://bit.ly/2S28s3G

District 99 is committed to achieving a school climate in which every student has opportunities for success. Our equity and inclusion initiatives started in 2013 with professional development for our staff, and focused on promoting change through self-reflection. This year, we've started our most critical piece of this work by involving and empowering our students.

More than 300 D99 students participated in the "My Name, My Story Changemakers" workshop this week. These students were selected to lead and guide District 99 towards engaging all students in the important work of equity and inclusion. Student leaders came together to share their stories, build empathy and drive change. Read more about the District's equity and inclusion work here: http://bit.ly/2Ms0uNC.

Thank you to the District 99 Education Foundation for funding this valuable workshop!

View more photos here: http://bit.ly/2OCGz18

post_text:
Congratulations to the 513 senior students who have achieved academic honors!

This year, 66 students achieved the designation of “Distinguished Honors” after receiving a cumulative 4.4 or higher weighted grade point average after seven semesters in high school. In addition, 447 students achieved the designation of “High Honors” or “Honors” after receiving a cumulative 4.0 or higher or 3.4 or higher weighted grade point average.

“These students have consistently achieved a very high level of academic performance throughout their high school years, which is an impressive accomplishment,” says District 99 Superintendent Dr. Hank Thiele. “Their focus on academic excellence will serve them well in all of their future endeavors.”

As a result, many schools have begun to search for ways to help improve the social and emotional well-being of their students.
